Alright, new things, firstly, I will not be rating this game due to the NFT controversy as of writing, everyone forgot about it anyways, it's a licensing thing as far as I know, anyways...

I don't think this game deserves some of the hate it gets, it is a lot better than people make it out to be, you'd be surprised how many perks are good other than the meta (after all, its all about play style), a lot of people have criticised the SBMM (Skill Based Match Making), I can not say anything about this, I had one negative experience where i went against a Dwight with a legacy cosmetic with 10k hours.. as nurse (which I barely play), anyways, the actual game play has little to no complaints from me, each mechanic (the new "boons" too) are well thought out and actually useful, its very fun on both sides, provided you don't sweat every game because hey, maybe only using the best stuff gets boring and SBMM isn't something you should worry about especially because you can't see it, it's just a number, although lets get to the things I don't like about the game play, not a mechanic, per se, but rather a technique that is really annoying...AND INEFFECTIVE!

face camping (literally being up in a hooked person's face) is the most boring strategy for both sides, not to be confused with proxy camping (being near the hook, it is hard to save, but still possible with it's own risks for both sides), this is because essentially, 2 people, 1 of them being the CORE ELEMENT OF THE MATCH, aren't playing the game, this sucks for the survivors as they essentially leave someone to die, and it sucks for the killer because they aren't playing the game, AND IT ISN'T DISCOURAGED (as of yet, the developers say they plan to change this, don't worry too much about this technique, though, rarely will someone uses it although it happens)

outside the game play, however is where more issues arise...
the grind, my...GOD IS IT TEDIOUS, it's gonna take a LOOOOOOOOONG time before you'll get the perks you want on the killer you like, and the prestige system (will be changed in the future) is more detrimental than helpful, essentially you reset that whole character AAAAALL the way back to level 1 for a bloody (literally) cosmetic and *slightly* higher chances for rarer items in the progression system known as the bloodweb, oh and let us not forget that this game has the DBD fanbase

all I will say is...STAY AWAY FROM THE FOLLOWING:
DBD Twitter
DBD forums (debatable)
DBD Steam forums
these are notorious places of...unkind mannerisms, except for maybe the official forums, especially on QnA "ask questions" times

oh, and a few quick notes: optimisation isn't too great, lower end PC's might need lower graphics, visual settings are lacking (it's really hard to enable or disable Vsync for example) and this game can be very BUGGY, especially after updates, so if a new character comes out, wait before you buy

other than the above mentioned issues, this game can be a blast, especially with friends or once you get that dream build, so this game gets a 8.8/10, worth the money

It's a simple but dynamic experience. Thrilling in all the right ways at first as you're placed in your own personal horror scenario. The rush from evading the killer is just as great as the sense of power you feel when you down a survivor. The characters which aren't licenced are unique and likable and have a great deal of care put into them. And while it is unfortionate that the full experience is hidden behind a paywall, If you're a big fan of the game it's wholly worth the additional expenses. And even if you play with what the base game has to offer there are still plenty of cool perk combinations to be made and a lot of fun to be had. Arguably the best part is the community, it's clear that the fans of this game care about it deeply and love to express that, as well as the devs who are ever active with updates and content for said fans.

All in all, I'm very happy with the game. Will always remember it fondly.
